title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

lucaa left at 10:10 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
sdumitriu - (10:16): Repairing myxwiki  
sdumitriu - (10:16): Then upgrading to 2.6RC1  
sdumitriu - (10:16): (+new colibri)  
cjdelisle - (10:26): Should see some performance improvements since attachments are never held on the heap anymore.  
sdumitriu - (10:32): jvelociter: Ping  
jbrBridge - (10:51): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] I have here a user account which is not capable to see some pages including Main.WebHome and his own User Page.  
jbrBridge - (10:51): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Also he isn't delivered the customized color theme.  
jbrBridge - (10:51): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] If he tries to access his user page I can see the following in the xwiki.log:  
jbrBridge - (10:51): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)]  com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 9001 in 9: Access to this document is denied: XWiki.XWikiUserSheet  
cjdelisle - (10:54): I assume you didn't explicitly deny that user access to those pages, did you deny access to the entire wiki?  
cjdelisle - (10:55): Perhaps you denied access for non members and for some reason that user is not in the XWikiAll group?  
sburjan` - (11:01): sdumitriu: first iterations of annotations tests have passed. Great ... :)  
sdumitriu - (11:01): jvelociter, xipe: Ping  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 11:04  
jbrBridge - (11:05): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] The user is included in the XWikiAll group.  
jbrBridge - (11:05): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Unregistered users may see the wiki (see https://www.computer42.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ )  
cjdelisle - (11:07): But this user cannot see the wiki?  
cjdelisle - (11:07): Check to see if he's in any odd groups and check global permissions for that user.  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 11:43  
Denis left at 11:45 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
Denis1 joined #xwiki at 11:45  
lucaa left at 11:46 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
Denis1 is now known as Denis ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
jbrBridge - (11:52): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] For testing I create a new user - but he has the same problem.  
jbrBridge - (11:52): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] An insufficient workaround is to put the user in the XWikiAdmin group :-/  
cjdelisle - (11:57): Perhaps you set a deny permission on XWikiAllGroup?  
jbrBridge - (12:09): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] No rights are specified for the XWikiAll group. In my 2nd Installation it is the same, but I havn't this problem.  
jbrBridge - (12:09): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] One difference I can see is that in the problematic installation I can't see this entry in the XWiki/Rights administration:  
jbrBridge - (12:09): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] "Require unregistered users to solve a captcha when posting a comment on a page"  
cjdelisle - (12:12): "Require unregistered users to solve a captcha when posting a comment on a page" Probably an older version then.  
jbrBridge - (12:13): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Solved: The XWikiAllGroup was missing the view right for the whole xwiki.  
cjdelisle - (12:13): That'll do it.  
jbrBridge - (12:15): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] [cjdelisle] : with captcha an old installation started early in 2009, upgraded constantly, now at 2.4.4  
jbrBridge - (12:15): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] without captcha: a fresh 2.4 installation  
cjdelisle - (12:17): I think that can happen when the .xar file isn't up to date. Not sure if I remember properly though.  
jbrBridge - (12:18): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] xar was regulary imported  
jbrBridge - (12:19): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Sorry - I have to leave. I will investigate the missing captcha in the next week  
jbrBridge - (12:19): [[[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)] Thanks  
cjdelisle - (12:19): Ok.  
cjdelisle - (12:19): No pb  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 12:22  
sdumitriu left at 12:23 (Ping timeout: 272 seconds  
venkatna joined #xwiki at 12:32  
venkatesh left at 12:34 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:34  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 12:38  
sdumitriu - (12:38): vmassol: Ping  
vmassol - (12:38): sdumitriu: yes?  
sdumitriu - (12:39): In your test for UNC paths, I see this:  
sdumitriu - (12:39): +.input|xhtml/1.0  
sdumitriu - (12:39): Shouldn't that be an expect?  
vmassol - (12:39): nope  
venkatna left at 12:39 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
sdumitriu - (12:39): Why?  
vmassol - (12:39): because that's not what I want to test :)  
vmassol - (12:39): I want to test 2 inputs  
vmassol - (12:39): and 2 expects  
vmassol - (12:40): for each  
sdumitriu - (12:40): OK  
vmassol - (12:40): that is in total: 4 tests  
sdumitriu - (12:40): Why don't you put the input at the start then?  
vmassol - (12:40): actualy there are 3 expects  
vmassol - (12:40): so that's 6 in total  
vmassol - (12:40): re the order I've followed the order we have used  
vmassol - (12:40): but yes we could decide to reorg it if we wanted  
vmassol - (12:40): not sure it's necessary though  
vmassol - (12:41): the initial reason it's at the end is because we get the annotated xhtml expect  
sdumitriu - (12:41): No, just nitpicking  
vmassol - (12:41): and then we copy paste it as the xhtml input  
vmassol - (12:41): but there's no good reason about the ordering  
lpereira left at 12:41 (Quit: Leaving.  
vmassol - (12:42): strictly speaking I don't think i need to test the xhmtl input for this specific test  
vmassol - (12:42): because it shouldn't be different from others  
vmassol - (12:42): but better be safe than sorry for unit tests  
vmassol - (12:42): (they execute fast)  
vmassol - (12:42): at some point we may want to rationalize a bit more  
sdumitriu - (12:44): OK, another thing  
sdumitriu - (12:44): +    public static final ResourceType UNC = new ResourceType("unc");  
sdumitriu - (12:44): In org/xwiki/rendering/listener/reference/ResourceType.jav  
sdumitriu - (12:44): Why do you list it there?  
sdumitriu - (12:44): Do all link types have to be listed there?  
sdumitriu - (12:44): Where's the extensibility then?  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 12:45  
jvelociter left at 12:48 (Quit: jvelociter  
vmassol - (12:48): they don't have too but they're known types for us  
vmassol - (12:48): it avoids string duplicaztion too  
vmassol - (12:49): so no they don't have to  
vmassol - (12:49): and yes we like to list the known ones there  
sdumitriu - (12:49): K  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 12:51

jvelociter\_ is now known as jvelociter ([[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
sdumitriu - (12:53): jvelociter: Ping  
jvelociter - (12:53): pong  
sdumitriu - (12:53): I have some problems with myxwiki  
sdumitriu - (12:53): Can you help?  
jvelociter - (12:54): I don't have too much time but maybe  
jvelociter - (12:54): you have access to the machine ?  
sdumitriu - (12:54): Yes  
mflorea left at 12:57 (Quit: Leaving.  
spliffy joined #xwiki at 13:17  
spliffy - (13:17): bonjour  
spliffy - (13:20): currently i am looking into the details of how to translate xwiki in german. But there is this "Jump to any page in the wiki"-Link that is ouput by javascript. Do we already have a framework for javascript internationalization in xwiki?  
sdumitriu - (13:22): Hi spliffy  
sdumitriu - (13:22): That string is not translatable yet  
spliffy - (13:23): i guess we'd have to invent a way to make the properties available to the javascript  
spliffy - (13:24): or inject the internationalized string into the script... mh  
sdumitriu - (13:28): There are two options  
sdumitriu - (13:28): Hm, OK, I'll make it translatable now  
spliffy - (13:28): hehe  
spliffy - (13:28): that would be very nice  
vmassol - (13:29): jvelociter: do you want this issue for 2.2.7: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5657 ?  
vmassol - (13:29): maybe you meant 2.7M1?  
jvelociter - (13:29): vmassol: no mistake on my side  
jvelociter - (13:29): yes  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:30  
vmassol - (13:30): you're fixing it?  
jvelociter - (13:30): yes  
vmassol - (13:30): k  
sdumitriu - (13:30): I'm deleting 2.2.7  
jvelociter - (13:30): actually closed it, since I committed that yesterday  
sdumitriu - (13:30): Denis gave his OK  
vmassol - (13:30): sdumitriu: right. I'll send a mail to remove old branches from svn too  
spliffy - (13:31): do you know some good tool for translation of properties files?  
spliffy - (13:32): i'm fiddling around with shell commands right now to find missing properties  
sdumitriu - (13:32): spliffy: Do you know http://l10n.xwiki.org/ ?  
spliffy - (13:33): yes, but i wanted to try it before i post it online  
sdumitriu - (13:33): K  
marta\_ joined #xwiki at 13:56  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:14  
spliffy - (14:21): i wrote a little shell script to find untranslated properties. if anyone is interested, you can get it here: http://pastie.org/1277027  
marta\_ left at 14:35 (Ping timeout: 255 seconds  
lucaa left at 14:41 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
rrodriguez left at 14:46 (Quit: rrodriguez  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 14:48  
rrodriguez left at 14:55 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
spliffy - (15:24): the l10n webinterface is really nice. it's just not allways clear if single word properties are substantives or verbs.  
rrodriguez joined #xwiki at 15:38  
rrodriguez left at 15:48 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
venkatesh left at 16:22 (Ping timeout: 276 seconds  
spliffy - (17:10): mmh. i translated 300 properties now, put them in the xwiki core jar and restarted the webserver (jetty with hsqldb), but now internationalization doesn't work anymore with my language. others do still work. have you got any ideas what i might have done wrong? i check encoding and all files are encoded with iso-8859.  
sdumitriu - (17:11): All files should be ASCII + unicode escapes  
sdumitriu - (17:11): Use native2ascii to convert a file  
spliffy - (17:12): i used unicode escapes  
sdumitriu - (17:33): spliffy: XWIKI-5658  
spliffy - (17:35): niiice! :)  
spliffy - (17:36): this will certainly help convice my boss to use xwiki on monday  
sdumitriu - (17:36): This means that even the shortcuts used are localizable  
sdumitriu - (17:36): Unfortunately that will only be in 1.7  
sdumitriu - (17:36): (mid December)  
jvelociter - (17:39): sdumitriu: is the xwiki/fullscreenedit/fullscreenEdit.js still used ?  
jvelociter - (17:39): should we remove the file ?  
spliffy - (17:40): sdumitriu: well i don't care, as long as there is progress. thank you for implementing it  
sdumitriu - (17:40): jvelociter: No  
sdumitriu - (17:41): It should be removed  
sdumitriu - (17:41): I left it there for deprecation until the new fullscreen implementation was fully adopted  
jvelociter - (17:41): ok. other question : how hard do you think it would be to support fullscreen on any element with the new one ?  
jvelociter - (17:41): instead of just textareas  
sdumitriu - (17:42): Simple  
sdumitriu - (17:42): What kind of element?  
jvelociter - (17:42): say a div  
jvelociter - (17:43): (I'm looking at the code right now)  
jvelociter - (17:43): will give it a try  
jvelociter - (17:44): maybe we could introduce a "maximizable" CSS class  
sdumitriu - (17:44): Yep  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 17:53  
sdumitriu - (18:20): jvelociter: Did you succeed?  
jvelociter - (18:20): yes, it works fine  
sdumitriu - (18:20): K  
jvelociter - (18:20): tested only with a div, though  
jvelociter - (18:20): now the hard part is the rename  
jvelociter - (18:20): we can't call it fullscreenEdit anymore :)  
sdumitriu - (18:21): :)  
jvelociter - (18:21): should be fullscreen.js  
sdumitriu - (18:21): Yep  
jvelociter - (18:21): and be moved out of editors/  
sdumitriu - (18:21): And move it into resources/uicomponents  
jvelociter - (18:21): to uicomponents maybe  
jvelociter - (18:21): yes  
jvelociter - (18:21): I wonder if we can find a trick to make a smooth transition and not break people's includes  
jvelociter - (18:21): maybe a aspect in the JSX plugin  
jvelociter - (18:22): where we keep a map of deprecated resource paths  
jvelociter - (18:22): wdyt ?  
sdumitriu - (18:22): Aspect?  
sdumitriu - (18:22): By the way, the skinx plugin should be transformed into a component at some point  
spliffy - (18:57): is it possible to translate the prettyname of trunks/applications/search/src/main/resources/XWiki/SearchConfigClass.xml? it's displayed on the search administration page  
spliffy - (18:58): or do i have to use velocity for it?  
vmassol left at 18:59 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (19:02): Yes, it is possible  
sdumitriu - (19:03): The keys are already there  
sdumitriu - (19:03): For example, look for search.admin.configuration.title in ApplicationResources.propertie  
sdumitriu - (19:03): s  
vmassol joined #xwiki at 19:22  
spliffy - (19:23): ok, i will look into it later  
vmassol left at 19:26 (Client Quit  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 19:27  
sdumitriu - (19:36): jvelociter: XWIKI-3175 should be closed at some point  
sdumitriu - (19:36): There have been commits against it since January 2009  
spliffy left at 19:45 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
spliffy joined #xwiki at 19:47  
sdumitriu - (20:13): lucaa: You broke XE-542  
sdumitriu - (20:13): When you converted Main.Spaces into a macro you used the code from an older instance  
lucaa - (20:18): very probably that I did  
sdumitriu - (20:18): Fixing it  
lucaa - (20:18): since the code was lying there on my local for a while  
lucaa - (20:18): sorry  
lucaa - (20:19): I hope it's not a lot of work  
sdumitriu - (20:19): No  
sdumitriu - (20:24): And XE-713 as well  
lucaa - (20:33): i'm really sorry sergiu  
lucaa - (20:33): didn't know there was so much activity on the Main.Spaces :(  
sdumitriu - (20:34): No problem  
lucaa - (20:34): well, they're two regressions which is ugly :(  
sburjan` left at 20:51 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
jvelociter - (21:46): guys I have a JS bug that just rose out of the blue... I'm willing to pay a drink to whoever will help me understand how this is possible  
jvelociter - (21:46): see http://pastie.org/1277745  
jvelociter - (21:46): it used to work, and now just like that it give this, on both FF and Chrome  
jvelociter - (21:48): I'm out of ideas  
cjdelisle - (21:49): Where is it? do you have enough that I can see it happen in my browser?  
sdumitriu - (21:49): Hehe  
sdumitriu - (21:50): You entered into the twilight zone  
jvelociter - (21:50): cjdelisle: it's not online right now, but if it persists, I'll make it online for sure !  
cjdelisle - (21:51): Reminds me of that attachment bug which was repeatable for 1 day then couldn't be repeated no matter how hard I tried.  
sdumitriu - (21:52): jvelociter: Try  
sdumitriu - (21:52): console.log( this.reader.flagSet[ -this.flag ] );  
jvelociter - (21:54): what the fu !!!  
jvelociter - (21:54): haha this cannot be possible  
jvelociter - (21:54): it works  
sdumitriu - (21:54): Is this.flag supposed to be a number?  
sdumitriu - (21:54): Always?  
jvelociter - (21:55): yes  
sdumitriu - (21:55): Then you can use this.flag - 0 to do a fast conversion  
jvelociter - (21:56): lol  
jvelociter - (21:56): that's so odd  
jvelociter - (21:56): the weirdest thing is that it used to work, I did not change anything  
jvelociter - (21:57): haha  
jvelociter - (21:57): I just cannot believe this  
jvelociter - (22:01): "Never ask me to explain that commit :)"  
jvelociter - (22:01): this is my commit log  
jvelociter - (22:02): sdumitriu: you are good for a drink next time we meet ;)  
lpereira left at 22:15 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (22:18): jvelociter: what are the possible values for flag?  
sdumitriu - (22:19): I'm not sure this line is correct:  
sdumitriu - (22:19): +        var flagIcon =  this.reader.flagSet[-flag] ? this.reader.flagSet[-flag].icon : '';  
sdumitriu - (22:19): Ah, you fixed it in the next commit  
venkatesh left at 22:38 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
lucaa - (23:21): I am getting a lot of $xwiki.jsx.use lines displayed in my instance, before everything. Is that my local modifications or the latest snapshot?  
sdumitriu - (23:23): Did you use the war?  
lucaa - (23:24): yes  
sdumitriu - (23:26): The war doesn't have the jsx plugins configured  
lucaa - (23:27): hmm... is that new?  
sdumitriu - (23:27): No  
sdumitriu - (23:27): The war doesn't have many of the plugins  
lucaa - (23:29): ah  
lucaa - (23:30): yes, I installed the standard-web war...  
lucaa - (23:30): I wanted the enterprise one actually
